name: Create a deployment status

params.name: state
params.description: The state of the status. Can be one of `error`, `failure`, `inactive`, `pending`, or `success`. **The `inactive` state requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.**

params.name: target_url
params.description: The target URL to associate with this status. This URL should contain output to keep the user updated while the task is running or serve as historical information for what happened in the deployment.

params.name: log_url
params.description: This is functionally equivalent to `target_url`. We will continue accept `target_url` to support legacy uses, but we recommend modifying this to the new name to avoid confusion. **This parameter requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.**

params.name: description
params.description: A short description of the status. Maximum length of 140 characters.

params.name: environment_url
params.description: Sets the URL for accessing your environment. **This parameter requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.**

params.name: auto_inactive
params.description: Adds a new `inactive` status to all non-transient, non-production environment deployments with the same repository and environment name as the created status's deployment. **This parameter requires a custom media type to be specified. Please see more in the alert below.**
